title: Carbamate
summary: A carbamate is a category of organic compounds that is formally derived from carbamic acid (NH2COOH).  The term includes organic compounds (e.g., the ester ethyl carbamate), formally obtained by replacing one or more of the hydrogen atoms by other organic functional groups; as well as salts with the carbamate anion H2NCOOâˆ’ (e.g. ammonium carbamate).
